title: Antietam National Battlefield: Multimedia Presentations
body: Multimedia Presentations              Civil War Through Civil Rights: A Nation's Journey   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:3 minutes, 42 seconds  Civil War Through Civil Rights: A Nation's Journey               Battle Reenactment Policy (Long)   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:4 minutes, 28 seconds  National Park Service reenactment policy video (long version)               Battle Reenactment Policy (Short)   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:1 minute, 12 seconds  National Park Service reenactment policy video (short version)           Dunker Church Keith Snyder-NPS  The Antietam Memorial Illumination is held yearly, the first Saturday in December. Over 23,000 luminaries are placed across the field to represent each casuality that occurred on September 17, 1862. Click here (Quicktime Video-7:30 length-10.6 MB) to see the illumination video and for more information, visit our Memorial Illumination page.        Cannon Firing Demonstration Keith Snyder-NPS  Also known as the 'King of Battle', artillery played a key role at Antietam. This video will explore the different types of cannon that were involved in the battle, as well as how the big guns were loaded and fired. Click here for the video, QuickTime 15.2 MB. Click here to go to our artillery page.        Alexander Gardner's traveling darkroom at the Burnside Bridge   Alexander Gardner took 70 photographs of the battlefield starting just two days after the battle. This was the first time an American battlefield had ever been photographed before the dead had been buried. Click here to view a Windows Media Video (WMV 4:19 length-13.7 MB) on Gardner at Antietam. To see more of Gardner's photographs click here.
